title: PPRE Bukukan Laba Rp194,69 Miliar, Pertambangan Jadi PenopangKamis, 30/10/2025, 17:52 WIB
summary:
1. PT PP Presisi Tbk (PPRE) has reported a net profit of Rp194.69 billion for the third quarter of 2025, driven by strong performance from its mining and construction services, which have remained stable throughout the year.
    2. The growth is attributed to consistent operational efficiency and good corporate management, as stated by the company's Financial and Human Capital Management Director, Mohammad Arif Iswahyudi, during the PP Presisi 2025 Public Expose held on October 30, 2025, at Wisma Subiyanto, Plaza PP, Jakarta Timur.
    3. Looking ahead, PPRE plans to further strengthen its competence in the mining sector by enhancing heavy equipment productivity and implementing digital technology in operational activities. The mining sector is expected to be a key driver of the company's performance amidst the slowdown in infrastructure project development. The company also aims to expand its mining project portfolio, which has high growth potential.

title: Kebijakan Moneter Ditantang Makin Populernya Stablecoin Dolar AS
summary:
1. The growing popularity of US dollar-backed stablecoins poses significant challenges for global monetary policy in the coming year.
    2. V. Anantha Nageswaran, an economic advisor in India, warns that the increasing use of stablecoins could potentially undermine the seigniorage of certain countries, affecting monetary transmission and monetary policy.
    3. Nageswaran also suggests that stablecoins could become a new source of competition for the banking sector, particularly in the areas of financial intermediation and attracting deposits from customers.

title: Laba Bersih Indosat (ISAT) Terpangkas Jadi Rp3,58 Triliun per Kuartal III 2025
summary:
1. PT Indosat Tbk (ISAT) has reported a decline in its quarterly earnings for Q3 2025, with a net profit of Rp3,58 trillion, a 7.49% year-on-year (YoY) decrease from Rp3,87 trillion in the same period last year.
    2. The decline is also evident in revenue, with total revenue for ISAT falling 1.6% from Rp41,81 trillion to Rp41,16 trillion. The drop is primarily due to a decrease in the mobile segment, which fell 1.9% to Rp34.5 trillion, although the MIDI segment saw a slight increase to Rp6 trillion.
    3. Meanwhile, fixed communication revenue was negatively impacted by a 9.9% decrease to Rp604 billion. Management explains that the decline in mobile revenue is mainly due to a drop in data, voice, and SMS, although there is still growth in value-added services and interconnection. On the other hand, the increase in MIDI revenue is due to growth in IT

Managing Director Research Samuel Securities Indonesia, Harry Su, views the BEI's conservative approach to lowering the target for 2026 as cautious, but many see it as a step towards adjusting to market dynamics and improving liquidity quality, which has become a concern. According to Harry, the BEI should focus on strengthening its early detection system for manipulative activities in the Indonesian capital market, while at the same time promoting investor education to be more critical of high-risk stocks. title: Source: https://market.bisnis.com/read/20251030/7/1924637/pengertian-dan-cara-membaca-relative-rotation-graph-rrg-saham-sektoral
summary:
1. The Relative Rotation Graph (RRG) is a technical analysis tool used by market players to measure and plot the relative performance of sector stocks against a benchmark index.
    2. The RRG concept was first introduced by Julius de Kempenaer, a Dutch technical analyst, in the early 2000s, to graphically represent the relative relationship among various sector stocks within a single graph that is easy to read and interpret.
    3. The RRG chart is divided into four quadrants, namely Leading, Weakening, Lagging, and Improving, which represent the relative strength cycles of a stock or sector compared to the benchmark. The direction and speed of rotation of the points in the chart are important indicators for reading potential market shifts.

title: Source: https://market.bisnis.com/read/20251030/7/1924580/bei-akan-pompa-free-float-emiten-jadi-25-dari-kapitalisasi-pasar
summary: Indonesian Stock Exchange (BEI) is working to increase the number of shares held by the public, or free float, to 25% of the market capitalization of listed companies. Jeffrey Hendrik, Director of Development at BEI, stated that the process of increasing free float is currently ongoing. He mentioned that BEI aims for free float to continue increasing. "At least for the evaluation of constituents of LQ45 this month, it has already been implemented with a minimum of 10% [free float]," said Jeffrey in Jakarta, Wednesday (29/10/2025). He explained that at present, the shares of companies included in the LQ45 index have already implemented a minimum free float of 10%. He added that some companies have been removed as constituents of LQ45 because they do not meet the free float requirements. Previously, Director of Valuation of Companies I Gede Nyoman Yetna stated that BEI plans to make adjustments to the classification of free float based on tiering of market capitalization after the public offering. title: Source: https://market.bisnis.com/read/20251029/7/1924461/pelaku-pasar-buka-suara-soal-target-ipo-hingga-transaksi-bei-2026
summary: the financial market has expressed concerns about the target IPO and daily transaction value (RNTH) set by the Indonesia Stock Exchange (BEI) for 2026. However, this is not seen as a sign of pessimism from the BEI, but rather a focus on the quality of the capital market rather than the quantity of the target. The BEI aims to have an average daily transaction value (RNTH) of IDR 14.5 trillion and 50 listed companies through IPO in 2026. This target RNTH is lower compared to the realizations of the last three months, which were IDR 16.5 trillion. Meanwhile, the BEI also revised its IPO target from 66 companies to 45 companies this year. With that, the IPO target for next year is smaller compared to the initial year target set by the BEI. However, Head of Research Kiwoom Securities Liza Camelia, views that the BEI's decision to lower the RNTH is not a sign of pessimism towards the market conditions next year. Instead, it is a realistic move taken by the BEI. "

title: Source: https://market.bisnis.com/read/20251029/7/1924445/bei-targetkan-ipo-2026-ada-50-emiten-konservatif-atau-realistis
summary: Bursa Efek Indonesia (BEI) has set a target of 50 Initial Public Offerings (IPOs) for the year 2026, with an average daily transaction value (RNTH) of Rp14.5 trillion. Market players view this target as realistic. A financial analyst from Universitas Indonesia, Budi Frensidy, considers the average daily transaction value target for the following year as conservative, at Rp14.5 trillion. "However, the number of IPOs, up to 50 companies, may be realistic, especially if BEI indeed prioritizes quality over quantity and given that the target for this year has been reduced to 45 companies," Budi said, on Wednesday (29/10/2025). Budi further stated that in 2026, BEI has a crucial task to be built like the IT scam that harms investors, in addition to dealing with manipulative practices in other areas. summary: PT Chandra Asri Pacific Tbk (TPIA) is preparing to invest $1 billion (approximately Rp16.6 trillion) and acquire assets in Singapore to strengthen its position as a regional energy and petrochemical player. title: Source: https://market.bisnis.com/read/20251029/7/1924356/bei-targetkan-ipo-2025-jadi-45-perusahaan-tambah-3-lagi-sekelas-cdia-ratu
summary:
1. The Jakarta Stock Exchange (BEI) has lowered its target for Initial Public Offerings (IPOs) this year from 66 to 45 companies, with 23 IPOs already registered and 13 more in the pipeline.
    2. BEI aims to register 50 IPOs next year, and has also set a target for various financial products such as bonds, exchange-traded funds (ETFs), exchange-traded notes (EBA), structured warrants, and derivatives.
    3. BEI is also focusing on quality rather than quantity, with a target of 5 lighthouse IPOs this year, and an additional 3 in the pipeline. The aim is to attract more large companies to the capital market.

title: Source: https://market.bisnis.com/read/20251029/7/1924320/apa-itu-msci-daftar-saham-dan-mengapa-penting-bagi-investor
summary: Morgan Stanley Capital International (MSCI) is a leading research company based in the United States. According to Investopedia, MSCI is an investment research company that performs indexing, risk analysis, and performance portfolio analysis, and provides governance tools to institutional investors and hedge funds. Morgan Stanley was founded by Henry S. Morgan and Harold Stanley in 1935, initially focusing on investment banking. Over time, the business grew, and in 1986, Morgan Stanley purchased the license for Capital International, the first company to introduce global stock market indices outside the US. Since then, MSCI has used the acronym MSCI. In 2004, MSCI acquired Barra. In its 2004 release, MSCI explained that Barra was a risk management and portfolio analysis company. MSCI hoped that with this acquisition, it would become the global leader in index benchmarking and risk management. The Barra acquisition cost $816.4 million. Today, MSCI is known as a global index provider used as a benchmark by international investors. The inclusion of a stock in the MSCI index has significant implications for the stock's performance,

summary:
1. The Indonesia Stock Exchange (BEI) has set a new target for 2026, aiming for a daily transaction value (RNTH) of Rp14.5 trillion, with an expected 50 new IPOs.
    2. The context is that the BEI is aiming to register 555 new securities this year, up from around 400 in the previous year, with a target of 45 IPOs this year, down from 66 at the start of the year.
    3. The potential implications of these targets are that the BEI is optimistic about the growth of the stock market and the number of new IPOs, with an increase in the number of Lighthouse IPOs to 6 companies. The BEI is also targeting 2 million new market investors in 2026. title: Source: https://market.bisnis.com/read/20251029/7/1924224/ubah-metodologi-free-float-bei-bakal-diskusi-dengan-msci
summary: the Indonesia Stock Exchange (BEI) will hold discussions with MSCI regarding the change in the free float calculation methodology within the MSCI index. Ignatius Denny Wicaksono, Head of Business Development 2 BEI, stated that due to the change in methodology, the BEI is currently working with the Central Securities Depository Indonesia (KSEI) to ensure that the data provided in the future is accessible. Therefore, users of indices such as MSCI and FTSE should have the same understanding in calculating free float. "Later, users of indices such as MSCI and FTSE, we should all have the same understanding in calculating free float," said Denny, Tuesday (28/10/2025). Denny also stated that the BEI is also able to discuss with MSCI to ensure that their expectations are aligned and appropriate. "We don't want anything excessive to be applied to the Indonesian capital market, as there is actually nothing special about it," he said. He also stated that the BEI is continuing efforts to help Indonesian companies enter global indices such as MSCI or FTSE. According to him, the BEI hopes

summary: PT Hanjaya Mandala Sampoerna Tbk (HMSP) reported a net profit of Rp4.51 trillion for the third quarter of 2025, a decrease of 5.34% year-on-year (YoY) compared to Rp88.47 trillion in the same period last year. The company's sales also declined. According to the financial report, HM Sampoerna's clean sales for the January-September 2025 period were Rp83.74 trillion, down from Rp83.74 trillion in the same period last year. The largest sales came from the third-party segment in the domestic market, specifically the Sigaret Kretek Mesin (SKM) segment, which accounted for 54.25% of total sales. summary: 1. Jasa Marga, a state-owned toll road company in Indonesia, reported a 17.33% decrease in net profit for the third quarter of 2025, with a net profit of Rp2.72 trillion, down from Rp3.3 trillion in the same period last year. The company's revenue fell by 6.11% to Rp21.08 trillion, while toll segment revenue increased by 5.31% to Rp13.41 trillion. Non-toll revenue remained relatively stable at Rp1.10 trillion, down 0.66% year on year. Construction segment revenue, however, declined by 23.72% year on year to Rp6.55 trillion. The company's efficiency improved, with operating expenses falling by 12.68% year on year to Rp12.50 trillion. title: Source: https://market.bisnis.com/read/20251030/192/1924544/optimisme-goto-kerek-target-ebitda-capai-rp19-triliun-tahun-ini
summary: PT GoTo Gojek Tokopedia Tbk (GOTO) has revised its EBITDA target for the year 2025 to potentially reach between Rp1.8 trillion and Rp1.9 trillion, up from its previous target of Rp1.4 trillion to Rp1.6 trillion for this year. This upward revision is due to the strong financial performance in the first nine months and third quarter of 2025, according to Patrick Walujo, GoTo's Chief Executive Officer. The company is consistently growing and improving profitability as it strives to become a global-class technology platform used by the Indonesian community. In the third quarter, GoTo reported an adjusted EBITDA of Rp62 billion, marking the first time it has reached such a figure. "Through this momentum, we are raising our EBITDA guidance for the full year to between Rp1.8 trillion and Rp1.9 trillion, which reinforces our confidence in our ability to create sustainable growth and long-term value for all stakeholders," said Patrick in a press release quoted by Bisnis.com on Thursday (30/1
